title: [Large-scale] VR-Based Multimodal Mathematics Concept Exploration: An Integrated Approach for Multilingual Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and ability to use digital devices
context.additional_context: A course where multilingual learners investigate mathematical abstract concepts through visual, auditory, and tactile interactions in VR environments. Concept application abilities are assessed through project-based evaluations

learning_goals: Learners can explain core calculus concepts (limits, continuity, rates of change) by manipulating 3D graphs in a VR environment.

In teams of four, learners will document the problem-solving process for 3 math problems using multimodal representations (2 visual models, 1 audio explanation, 3+ text annotations), achieving an "Excellent" grade in at least 4 out of 5 peer evaluation rubric items.

Learners will analyze fluid dynamics data (3+ variables: velocity, pressure, temperature) collected from VR simulations, establish a mathematical model based on differential equations, and create a 10-minute presentation achieving an 80%+ success rate in peer and instructor evaluations.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
